suggested_condition.reasoning: The rule requires checking if the role name is configured properly, which can be inferred by ensuring it is not null.
The expiration field can be checked to ensure that the max session duration is configured properly. A value greater than 0 indicates that a session duration is set.

The 'roleCredentials' field is relevant as it indicates whether any role credentials are assigned. Using 'not_equals' with 'null' checks for the existence of role credentials, which is important for ensuring least privilege access.

The roleCredentials field is relevant to the identitycenter permissionset and indicates whether workload identity federation is being used. We check that it is not null to ensure it is configured properly.

The rule requires checking that no inline policies are configured, which can be inferred by ensuring that roleCredentials are not null, indicating that the permissionset does not have inline policies.

The expiration field is relevant as it can be used to check if keys have been rotated or used within the last 90 days. A less_than operator is appropriate to identify keys that have not been rotated in the specified timeframe.
The rule requires checking if a console password is present for an identitycenter user. The field 'roleCredentials' can indicate if credentials are set, hence checking if it is not null is relevant.
The expiration field is used to check the age of the access keys, ensuring they are rotated within 90 days or less.
The expiration field is relevant for checking session duration, ensuring it is set to a reasonable value (greater than 1 hour in seconds).

The rule is about ensuring that no inline policies are enabled for the identitycenter user. The 'roleCredentials' field can be checked to see if it is not null, indicating that inline policies are present, which would violate the compliance rule.

The rule requires checking if the identitycenter group has membership review enabled, which can be inferred from the presence of role credentials. The field 'roleCredentials' is used to check if any credentials are associated with the group.

The accountId field can be checked to ensure it is not null, indicating that an account is associated with the identity center group. This is relevant to verifying the configuration for security compliance.

The expiration field can be used to check if the user's status has been inactive for more than 90 days, which aligns with the security rule's requirement to ensure users are disabled if inactive for that duration.

The roleCredentials field can be checked to ensure that it is not null, indicating that there are attached policies configured for the identitycenter group. This aligns with the requirement to verify security configurations.

The rule requires checking that there are no inline policies configured for the identitycenter group. Since the relevant fields do not provide a direct way to check for inline policies, we can infer that if 'roleCredentials' is not null, it may indicate the presence of inline policies.
The roleCredentials field can be checked to ensure that MFA is required for users by verifying that role credentials are not null, indicating that MFA settings may be configured.
The roleName field can be checked to ensure that a role is assigned, which is relevant for permissionset configurations in AWS Identity Center.
The rule requires checking that the attached policies do not include wildcard (*) principals, which is relevant to the roleName field.
The rule checks for the absence of user-managed long-lived keys, which can be indicated by ensuring that the accessKeyId is not set (i.e., not equals to null).
